each trying to snatch from the other a boot they were both holding on to. 
"You picked it up? ... I dare say! You're very smart!" one of them shouted hoarsely. 
Then a thin, pale soldier, his neck band- aged with a bloodstained leg band, came up and in angry tones asked the artillerymen for water. 
"Must one die like a dog?" said he. 
Tushin told them to give the man some wa- ter. Then a cheerful soldier ran up, begging a little fire for the infantry.
